bestBHT.bht: The disciples were faced with a challenging situation, as the crowd was hungry and there seemed to be no solution in sight. However, Jesus instructed them to take action and provide food for the people, emphasizing that no situation is too desperate for Him to handle. Although the disciples may have felt inadequate and lacking resources, they obeyed and through Christ's power, they were able to meet the needs of the crowd. This teaches us that our duty is not determined by our own abilities or resources, but by Christ's command. He assures His people that He will never allow them to lack what is necessary and will always provide for their needs.

John Calvin: We have no right, indeed, to expect that Christ will always follow this method of supplying the hungry and thirsty with food; but it is certain that he will never permit his own people to want the necessaries of life, but will stretch out his hand from heaven, whenever he shall see it to be necessary to relieve their necessities.
Those who wish to have Christ for their provider, must first learn not to long for refined luxuries, but to be satisfied with barley-bread.

To the same purpose is what follows, that he gave them the loaves, in order that in their hands the astonishing increase might take place, and that they might thus be the ministers of Christ’s divine power; for as if it had been of small importance that they should be eye-witnesses, Christ determined that his power should be handled by them.
Philip Schaff: Give ye them to eat. Obedience seemed impossible, but they did obey through Christ’s power providing the means for them."
Duty is measured by Christ’s command, not by our resources.
Archibald T. Robertson: The emphasis is on υμεις in contrast (note position) with their 'send away' (απολυσον).
It is the urgent aorist of instant action (δοτε).
The disciples were to learn that 'no situation appears to Him desperate, no crisis unmanageable' (Bruce).
John Gill: They need not depart; meaning so long as he was with them, who had power enough to provide a sufficient meal for them."
As well as by a word speaking, to heal their diseases."
Give ye them to eat; such provisions as you have along with you.

bhtAttempts.bht: The disciples were faced with a challenging situation, as the crowd was hungry and there seemed to be no solution in sight. However, Jesus instructed them to take action and provide food for the people, emphasizing that no situation is too desperate for Him to handle. Although the disciples may have felt inadequate and lacking resources, they obeyed and through Christ's power, they were able to meet the needs of the crowd. This teaches us that our duty is not determined by our own abilities or resources, but by Christ's command. He assures His people that He will never allow them to lack what is necessary and will always provide for their needs.

The disciples were instructed to give food to the crowd, a seemingly impossible task. Despite their lack of resources, they obeyed, relying on Christ's power to provide. This teaches us that our duty is measured by Christ's command, not our own abilities. We should not underestimate what God can do through us. Furthermore, this passage highlights that Christ never allows His people to go without what they need. He is always ready to provide and empower us to be His instruments of provision.

The disciples were confronted with a seemingly desperate situation, but Jesus emphasized that no crisis is beyond His ability to handle. He urged them to take immediate action, demonstrating their obedience and faith. Though they may have felt ill-equipped, they trusted in Christ's command, not their own resources. Through His divine power, Jesus multiplied the loaves and used the disciples as vessels to distribute the food. This miraculous event showcases the abundant provision and care Jesus has for His people, assuring us that we don't need to worry about our basic needs.

The disciples were instructed to respond to the hungry crowd, despite their own perceived limitations. Jesus emphasized that no situation is too desperate for Him to handle, and urged them to take immediate action. Through their obedience and faith, they were able to provide for the people, relying on Christ's power to multiply the loaves. This event highlights Christ's ability to meet the needs of His people and to work through them, empowering them to be agents of His divine power.

Jesus instructed the disciples to provide food for the crowd, emphasizing that no situation is too desperate or unmanageable for Him. Despite feeling ill-equipped, the disciples obeyed with faith and through Christ's power, they were able to meet the needs of the people. This event teaches us that our duty is not measured by our own resources, but by Christ's command. He will never allow His people to lack what is necessary, and He works through us to demonstrate His divine power and provision.
